etymology.description: phonetic: 才 + phonetic: 士 (later altered to 土 'earth')
etymology.interpretation: Originally written with two phonetic elements, 才 and 士, to indicate the sound. Over time 士 shifted in form to 土, which readers later interpreted semantically as ‘earth/ground’, aligning with senses like ‘to be at/on; located’. In modern form it appears as semantic 土 plus phonetic 才.

examples.chinese: 我在北京工作(我在北京工作)。
她现在不在家(她現在不在家)。
examples.english: She is not at home right now.

examples.chinese: 这个传统仍然存在(這個傳統仍然存在)。
